meanings.definition: Boldness or daring, especially with confident disregard for personal safety or conventional thought.
meanings.sent1: Her audacity in standing up to the bully impressed everyone at school.
meanings.sent2: The explorer showed great audacity when he ventured into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent3: With audacity, the little kitten tried to scare away the big dog.
meanings.sent4: His audacity to climb the highest mountain symbolized his determination.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's audacity in facing danger inspired the whole city.

meanings.sent1: She gave him an audacity smile after pulling off the prank.
meanings.sent2: The audacity student cheated on the test without any remorse.
meanings.sent3: The audacity squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: His audacity lie about winning the race was quickly exposed.
meanings.sent5: The audacity behavior of the raccoon caused chaos in the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The criminal's audacity in robbing the bank shocked the entire town.
meanings.sent2: Her audacity in skydiving without any training amazed her friends.
meanings.sent3: The audacity of the penguin trying to fly made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His audacity in challenging the champion boxer was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The audacity of the acrobat's performance left the audience in awe.
